name: NPR
text: Between the coronavirus and the election, the news is overwhelming right now. This comic lays out a few tips to help you cope. https://t.co/CO35EFl2kT

name: NPR
text: President Trump is doubling down on claims that the results of the presidential election must be known on election night. But the vote totals are never fully counted the same day. https://t.co/RDCLNM5132

name: NPR
text: The Trump administration has issued an executive order that would fundamentally restructure the federal workforce â€” making it easier to fire thousands of federal workers, while also allowing political considerations to affect hiring. https://t.co/e8FTDBDKHb

name: NPR
text:
For months now, election officials have cautioned that the winner of the presidential election may still be unknown when election night is over.

Here's a closer look at what to expect in six particularly key states:
https://t.co/HL3fHxw7J5

name: NPR
text:
Name a well-known U.S. city in two words (5,3). Change the first letter of the second word to name a popular rock group. Who is it?

If you know the answer to next week's challenge, submit it here. ðŸ‘‡
https://t.co/Q1VkwDlmZf

name: NPR
text: The National Museum of Mexican Art in Chicago does an annual exhibit for the Day of the Dead. This year, it's centered on those who have died â€” and will die â€” in the pandemic. https://t.co/gBatY0QwRf

name: NPR
text: Here are seven tips for dealing with uncertainty, from people who've been there. https://t.co/tENc1sPa4V

name: NPR
text:
Multiple studies have shown that the pandemic is exacerbating the symptoms of some people with OCD. 
https://t.co/3DMXr0kCwp

name: NPR
text:
After the first presidential debate, many found respite in Christian Hull's TikToks. The Australian comedian watches paint being mixed and guesses the final color.

"I went to bed one night, woke up, and I had like 200,000 extra followers...all American."
https://t.co/LT1Pgo9JB4

name: NPR
text:
"Many Americans have now returned to a semblance of life, but frontline families like ours continue to bear the greatest risk in this pandemic," writes photographer Melissa Bunni Elian.

She's been documenting her mother, a health care worker in NYC.
https://t.co/VUO4yvj4Od

name: NPR
text:
In "American Selfie," Alexandra Pelosi says she tried to capture the two opposing sides in the U.S. right now. 

The documentary is a look at a divided country â€” but it's also a critique of Americansâ€™ obsession with phones and consumerism. @hereandnow https://t.co/MCpcznAZwi

name: NPR
text: We spent weeks asking experts how a polarized nation can move forward following the results of Tuesday's election. They say healing is possible, but people have to be willing to try. https://t.co/DnWJmWjFsU

name: NPR
text:
An American actor buys a 200-year-old Italian home for 1 euro. What could go wrong? Well, a lot, as it turns out.

In her new HGTV show, Lorraine Bracco renovates â€” really renovates â€” an abandoned house she bought in Sicily.
 https://t.co/kQW2i1bWua

name: NPR
text:
Gunmen stormed Afghanistan's largest university on Monday â€” killing at least 19 people in an hours-long attack.
https://t.co/WRm0AJEM7i

name: NPR
text:
Lagging in the polls, President Trump may close out his campaign with an election eve rally in Grand Rapids tonight â€” the place he held his last rally of the 2016 campaign, in the wee hours of Election Day.
https://t.co/5NbXErdU4G

name: NPR
text:
In Texas, more voters have cast a ballot already than in the entire 2016 election.

More Texans have now voted in this election than in any election ever â€” by about 700,000 and counting, as of Sunday afternoon.
https://t.co/scordPpoT1

name: NPR
text:
White House coronavirus adviser Dr. Scott Atlas apologized on Sunday for doing an interview with Russia's state-backed RT network, saying he "was unaware they are a registered foreign agent."
https://t.co/CDqrn79lzq

name: NPR
text:
President Trump falsely said that votes cast in the 2020 election shouldn't be counted after Election Day.

This is wrong. In every election, votes take longer than one day to count and certify.
https://t.co/3F7cylQYvS

name: NPR
text:
The ratio of women in the workforce has fallen below 57% for the first time since 1988 â€” reversing years of gains.

That has economists very worried.
https://t.co/Uk5Rc3ZNmC

name: NPR
text:
Medicaid provides health care for millions of low-income Americans.

In the last 4 years, the Trump administration has given states ways to restrict spending on it. A Biden administration would push to expand coverage.
https://t.co/0jSyah2o4O

name: NPR
text:
Lagging in the polls and looking to rekindle the magic of 2016, President Trump may conclude his campaign with an election eve rally in Grand Rapids, Mich., tonight.
https://t.co/DbJGFmYW85

name: NPR
text:
No state ever reports its final results on election night.

Each state has its own laws for when it needs to certify the election's results â€” and none fall on Election Day itself.
https://t.co/t71gyzCdea

name: NPR
text:
Hurricane Eta is rapidly gaining strength as it churns toward the coast of Nicaragua.

Forecasters say it could bring "life-threatening storm surge, flash flooding and landslides."
https://t.co/IXQRiFt3os

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: #BREAKING: A federal judge in Texas has ruled that about 127,000 ballots cast in Harris County via curbside voting are valid and cannot be thrown out, despite a last-minute lawsuit on behalf of a group of Republican candidates and activists.#BREAKING: A federal judge in Texas has ruled that about 127,000 ballots cast in Harris County via curbside votingâ€¦ https://t.co/7Icd4CY8xA

name: NPR
text:
As the nation grapples with a major surge in new coronavirus cases, President Trump is suggesting that he might fire Dr. Anthony Fauci â€” the country's top infectious disease expert â€” after the election.
https://t.co/mhf7Fae4Gd

name: NPR
text:
This election is expected to have the highest voter turnout since 1908, says an expert at the University of Florida.

So far, more than 93.1 million people have voted early â€” nearly 68% of the total votes cast in 2016.
https://t.co/SX8PUliNR5

name: NPR
text:
RT @KUT: In June, @Chief_Manley pledged Austin Police would never again use beanbag rounds â€“Â which contain lead pellets and are fired from a 12-gauge shotgun â€“Â for crowd control.

But APD was quietly moving to restock its cache of "less lethal" rounds. https://t.co/3YN18IICwv

name: NPR
text:
For DÃ­a de los Muertos, families build altars, decorate graves and remember their loved ones. This year, many are remembering parents, siblings and children lost to COVID-19.
https://t.co/YL4O87o1ru

name: NPR
text:
The pandemic is straining small American colleges.

But some have distinct advantages over bigger schools in fighting the spread of coronavirus â€” including a smaller student body and a shared sense of purpose.
